title: CASH IN THE ATTIC: The rugby shirts that could fetch thousands of pounds
text:
Every week we give the low-down on the value of forgotten treasures that may be gathering dust at home.

The Rugby World Cup in Japan is proving a triumph for sports fans.

The most successful nation is New Zealand – and it has won the World Cup no less than three times since it began in 1987.

The record price for a rugby shirt is £180,000 paid in 2015 for the top worn by Irish-born New Zealander Dave Gallaher.

The record price for a rugby shirt is £180,000 paid in 2015 for this top worn by Irish-born New Zealander Dave Gallaher

He was the original ‘All Black’ captain of the team that was the first to tour the British Isles, between 1905 and 1906. This successful team won 34 out of the 35 matches it played.

Early international rugby programmes are also hugely collectable.

A historic rarity is the 1905 Wales v New Zealand programme at Cardiff Arms Park. This was the first time the All Blacks were beaten. Find a copy in the loft and you have a £5,000 investment.

England won the World Cup in 2003 – beating Australia 20-17 in Sydney when Jonny Wilkinson kicked a drop goal in the final minute of extra time. An England rugby shirt from 2003 signed by the winning squad now sells for £2,000.
